titles.title: Waiving points of order against the conference report to accompany the bill (H.R. 2539) to abolish the Interstate Commerce Commission, to amend subtitle IV of title 49, United States Code, to reform economic regulation of transportation, and for other purposes.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 104-425, by Mr. Quillen.
Rule provides for consideration of the conference report to H.R. 2539. All points of order against the conference report and against its consideration shall be waived.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 166.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 12/19/1995--Introduced. Waives points of order against the consideration of the conference report on H.R. 2539 (termination of Interstate Commerce Commission).
